page.title: 04Boynton School
page.content: Boynton School is about a quarter of a mile outside the village.It opened in 1910.There are two class rooms in the school.The main building is made of wood and asbestos sheeting.The old school house has been converted into a school kitchen,indoor toilets and a room for the secretary.School meals are sent from Kilham school.The school has a playing field,one acre in area, and there is a wood behind the school. There are some old outside toilets and a large playground with two climbing frames.There are thirty children in the school.Thirteen children come from Rudston,nine from Boynton,seven from Grindale and one from Bridlington. Twenty come by bus,seven by car and three walk.The school hours are from 8.50am to 3.30pm each day.
